description: Creates a rule in Amazon DataZone. A rule is a formal agreement that enforces specific requirements across user workflows (e.g., publishing assets to the catalog, requesting subscriptions, creating projects) within the Amazon DataZone data portal. These rules help maintain consistency, ensure compliance, and uphold governance standards in data management processes. For instance, a metadata enforcement rule can specify the required information for creating a subscription request or publishing a data asset to the catalog, ensuring alignment with organizational standards.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that is provided to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: The detail of the rule. metadataFormEnforcementDetail (dict) --- The enforcement detail of the metadata form. requiredMetadataForms (list) --- The required metadata forms. (dict) --- The reference of a metadata form. The type ID of the metadata form reference. The type revision of the metadata form reference.

nested_params.name: metadataFormEnforcementDetail
nested_params.description: The enforcement detail of the metadata form.

nested_params.name: typeIdentifier
nested_params.description: The type ID of the metadata form reference.

nested_params.name: typeRevision
nested_params.description: The type revision of the metadata form reference.

parameters.name: domainIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID of the domain where the rule is created.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the rule. assetType (dict) --- The asset type included in the rule scope. The selection mode for the rule. specificAssetTypes (list) --- The specific asset types that are included in the rule. (string) --- dataProduct (boolean) --- The data product included in the rule scope. project (dict) --- The project included in the rule scope. The selection mode of the rule. specificProjects (list) --- The specific projects in which the rule is created. (string) ---

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target of the rule. domainUnitTarget (dict) --- The ID of the domain unit. The ID of the domain unit. includeChildDomainUnits (boolean) --- Specifies whether to apply a rule to the child domain units.

nested_params.description: The ID of the domain unit.

nested_params.name: domainUnitId
nested_params.description: The ID of the domain unit.

nested_params.name: includeChildDomainUnits
nested_params.description: Specifies whether to apply a rule to the child domain units.
